description: Patterns for team dynamics issues including communication breakdowns, collaboration problems, and conflict resolution

patterns.name: Communication Breakdown Detection
patterns.description: Detects team communication issues including information silos, miscommunication, and ineffective communication channels

hypotheses.statement: Fragmented communication channels may be causing information loss and miscommunication for {{primarySubject}}
investigationSteps: Audit all communication channels used by the team (Slack, email, meetings, etc.)
Identify where critical information is being shared and potentially lost
Review channel usage patterns and information duplication
Assess whether team members know where to find information
Check for unofficial or shadow communication channels
expectedFindings: Multiple overlapping channels for similar purposes
Critical information scattered across different platforms
Team members missing important updates due to channel overload
No clear guidelines on which channel to use for what
Information silos between different communication tools

hypotheses.statement: Ineffective meetings may be contributing to communication breakdowns for {{primarySubject}}
investigationSteps: Review meeting frequency, duration, and attendance patterns
Assess meeting agendas and outcomes documentation
Survey team members about meeting effectiveness
Analyze time spent in meetings vs productive work
Check for missing stakeholders in key meetings
expectedFindings: Meetings without clear agendas or outcomes
Key decisions made without proper stakeholder involvement
Meeting overload reducing productive time
Action items not tracked or followed up
Important information shared only in meetings not documented

hypotheses.statement: Lack of documentation may be causing knowledge loss and communication issues for {{primarySubject}}
investigationSteps: Audit existing documentation and its currency
Identify critical knowledge that exists only in people's heads
Review documentation practices and standards
Assess accessibility and discoverability of documentation
Check for outdated or conflicting documentation
expectedFindings: Critical processes not documented
Documentation outdated or incomplete
Knowledge concentrated in few individuals
No standard documentation practices
Documentation hard to find or access

hypotheses.statement: Leadership communication gaps may be causing misalignment and confusion for {{primarySubject}}
investigationSteps: Review how leadership communicates priorities and decisions
Assess clarity and consistency of leadership messaging
Check for cascading communication effectiveness
Survey team members about understanding of direction
Analyze feedback loops from team to leadership
expectedFindings: Inconsistent messaging from different leaders
Priorities not clearly communicated to teams
Decisions made without explanation of rationale
Lack of regular leadership updates
Team members unclear on strategic direction

recommendations.action: Conduct comprehensive communication audit to identify gaps and inefficiencies for {{primarySubject}}
recommendations.expectedOutcome: Clear picture of communication patterns, gaps, and improvement opportunities

recommendations.action: Consolidate and clarify communication channels with clear guidelines
recommendations.expectedOutcome: Reduced channel fragmentation and clearer information flow

recommendations.action: Optimize meeting practices with agendas, outcomes, and documentation requirements
recommendations.expectedOutcome: More effective meetings with better information sharing

recommendations.action: Establish documentation standards and knowledge management practices
recommendations.expectedOutcome: Improved knowledge capture and accessibility

recommendations.action: Implement regular team updates and communication cadence
recommendations.expectedOutcome: Consistent information flow and reduced surprises

recommendations.action: Establish feedback loops to identify and address communication issues early
recommendations.expectedOutcome: Early detection and resolution of communication problems

patterns.name: Collaboration Issues Detection
patterns.description: Detects team collaboration problems including siloed work, lack of teamwork, and coordination failures

hypotheses.statement: Organizational silos may be preventing effective collaboration for {{primarySubject}}
investigationSteps: Map team boundaries and interaction patterns
Identify dependencies between teams that are not well-managed
Review organizational structure for collaboration barriers
Assess incentive structures that may discourage collaboration
Check for competing priorities between teams
expectedFindings: Teams operating independently with minimal interaction
Dependencies causing delays due to poor coordination
Organizational structure creating artificial barriers
Incentives focused on team goals vs shared outcomes
Competing priorities causing friction between teams

hypotheses.statement: Unclear ownership and responsibilities may be causing collaboration gaps for {{primarySubject}}
investigationSteps: Review RACI matrices and ownership documentation
Identify areas with overlapping or missing ownership
Assess how handoffs between teams are managed
Check for accountability gaps in cross-team work
Survey team members about role clarity
expectedFindings: Unclear or undocumented ownership for key areas
Multiple teams claiming or avoiding ownership
Handoffs falling through the cracks
No clear escalation paths for cross-team issues
Team members unsure of their responsibilities

hypotheses.statement: Fragmented or incompatible tools may be hindering collaboration for {{primarySubject}}
investigationSteps: Audit collaboration tools used across teams
Identify tool incompatibilities and integration gaps
Review tool adoption and usage patterns
Assess training and support for collaboration tools
Check for shadow IT and unofficial tools
expectedFindings: Different teams using incompatible tools
Lack of integration between collaboration platforms
Low adoption of official collaboration tools
Insufficient training on collaboration features
Workarounds due to tool limitations

hypotheses.statement: Missing or ineffective collaboration processes may be causing coordination failures for {{primarySubject}}
investigationSteps: Review existing collaboration processes and workflows
Identify where collaboration breaks down in practice
Assess process documentation and adherence
Check for missing processes for common collaboration needs
Survey team members about process effectiveness
expectedFindings: No defined processes for cross-team collaboration
Existing processes not followed consistently
Process gaps causing repeated coordination failures
Lack of visibility into cross-team work
Ad-hoc collaboration without structure

recommendations.action: Conduct collaboration assessment to identify barriers and improvement opportunities for {{primarySubject}}
recommendations.expectedOutcome: Clear understanding of collaboration patterns and barriers

recommendations.action: Establish cross-functional teams or working groups for key initiatives
recommendations.expectedOutcome: Improved collaboration on cross-cutting work

recommendations.action: Clarify ownership and responsibilities with RACI matrices and documentation
recommendations.expectedOutcome: Clear accountability and reduced coordination gaps

recommendations.action: Standardize and integrate collaboration tools across teams
recommendations.expectedOutcome: Seamless collaboration with integrated tooling

recommendations.action: Implement shared objectives and key results (OKRs) across teams
recommendations.expectedOutcome: Aligned incentives and improved cross-team collaboration

recommendations.action: Establish collaboration rituals like joint standups, demos, and retrospectives
recommendations.expectedOutcome: Regular touchpoints and improved team relationships

recommendations.action: Invest in team building activities to strengthen relationships
recommendations.expectedOutcome: Stronger interpersonal relationships and trust

patterns.name: Conflict Resolution Detection
patterns.description: Detects team conflicts including interpersonal disputes, disagreements, and tension that need resolution

hypotheses.statement: Role ambiguity or overlapping responsibilities may be causing conflicts for {{primarySubject}}
investigationSteps: Review role definitions and job descriptions
Identify areas of overlapping responsibility
Assess how decisions are made in contested areas
Check for resource competition between roles
Survey team members about role clarity
expectedFindings: Unclear boundaries between roles
Multiple people claiming ownership of same areas
Conflicts arising from decision-making authority
Competition for resources or recognition
Frustration due to stepping on each other's toes

hypotheses.statement: Different communication styles or preferences may be causing interpersonal friction for {{primarySubject}}
investigationSteps: Assess communication styles of team members involved
Review communication patterns that trigger conflicts
Check for cultural or generational communication differences
Identify specific communication behaviors causing friction
Survey team about communication preferences
expectedFindings: Clashing communication styles (direct vs indirect)
Misinterpretation of tone or intent
Cultural differences in communication norms
Feedback delivery causing defensive reactions
Written vs verbal communication preferences conflicting

hypotheses.statement: Misaligned values or priorities may be driving fundamental disagreements for {{primarySubject}}
investigationSteps: Identify core values and priorities of conflicting parties
Assess alignment with team and organizational values
Review decisions where value conflicts emerged
Check for competing success metrics
Explore underlying motivations and concerns
expectedFindings: Different priorities (speed vs quality, innovation vs stability)
Conflicting definitions of success
Values not explicitly discussed or aligned
Decisions triggering value-based disagreements
Lack of shared vision or purpose

hypotheses.statement: Competition for limited resources may be creating conflict between team members for {{primarySubject}}
investigationSteps: Identify scarce resources teams are competing for
Review resource allocation processes and fairness
Assess how resource conflicts are currently resolved
Check for zero-sum dynamics in resource distribution
Analyze impact of resource constraints on relationships
expectedFindings: Teams competing for budget, headcount, or tools
Perception of unfair resource allocation
Lack of transparent resource allocation process
Win-lose dynamics damaging relationships
Resource scarcity amplifying other conflicts

hypotheses.statement: Leadership gaps in conflict management may be allowing conflicts to escalate for {{primarySubject}}
investigationSteps: Review how leadership has handled past conflicts
Assess leadership training in conflict resolution
Check for avoidance patterns in addressing conflicts
Evaluate escalation paths and their effectiveness
Survey team about leadership support in conflicts
expectedFindings: Leaders avoiding or ignoring conflicts
Lack of conflict resolution skills in leadership
No clear escalation or resolution process
Inconsistent handling of similar conflicts
Team members feeling unsupported in conflicts

recommendations.action: Conduct confidential conflict assessment to understand root causes and dynamics for {{primarySubject}}
recommendations.expectedOutcome: Clear understanding of conflict sources and dynamics

recommendations.action: Facilitate mediation sessions between conflicting parties
recommendations.expectedOutcome: Resolution or de-escalation of active conflicts

recommendations.action: Clarify roles, responsibilities, and decision rights to reduce ambiguity
recommendations.expectedOutcome: Clear boundaries and reduced role-based conflicts

recommendations.action: Provide communication and conflict resolution training for the team
recommendations.expectedOutcome: Improved communication skills and conflict handling

recommendations.action: Establish team norms and working agreements for healthy conflict
recommendations.expectedOutcome: Shared expectations for handling disagreements constructively

recommendations.action: Build psychological safety to enable healthy conflict and honest dialogue
recommendations.expectedOutcome: Environment where disagreements can be expressed safely

recommendations.action: Establish clear escalation process for unresolved conflicts
recommendations.expectedOutcome: Clear path for resolving conflicts that can't be resolved locally

recommendations.action: Provide conflict management coaching for team leaders
recommendations.expectedOutcome: Leaders equipped to handle and prevent conflicts

testCases.input: We have a communication breakdown on the team and information is not being shared properly
Information silos are causing miscommunication and people are not on the same page
There's a communication gap between teams and unclear expectations are causing problems
Cross-functional communication is poor and stakeholder alignment is lacking
We have collaboration issues and teams are working in silos
There's a lack of teamwork and poor collaboration between departments
Coordination failure is causing cross-team issues and siloed teams are not working together
Team alignment is poor and we need better cross-functional collaboration with shared goals
We have team conflict that needs conflict resolution
There's interpersonal conflict and personality clashes causing team tension
Team disagreement is escalating and people are not getting along
We have a toxic team environment with constant disputes and need mediation
Team morale is low due to workplace conflict and we need to improve psychological safety
Communication breakdown is causing collaboration issues and teams are working in silos
Poor collaboration and team conflict are creating a hostile environment
We have communication breakdown, collaboration issues, and team conflict all affecting our team dynamics
